docs.title: Welcome to the Documentation
docs.text: This documentation demonstrates the vexy-mkdocs-strip-number-prefix plugin in action. The plugin strips numeric prefixes from documentation files to create clean URLs while maintaining file ordering.

docs.title: Navigation
docs.text:
Navigate through the sections below to explore different Markdown features:

  • Getting Started - Introduction and setup
  • Basic Syntax - Essential Markdown elements
  • Advanced Features - Extended Markdown capabilities
  • Examples - Real-world usage examples

docs.title: How It Works
docs.text:
Notice how the URLs in the navigation are clean and readable, even though the source files and directories use numeric prefixes like 010--, 020--, etc. for ordering.

Numeric Prefixes

The source structure uses prefixes like 010--getting-started but the URL becomes /getting-started/

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: Welcome to our documentation! This page demonstrates how the strip-number-prefix plugin works.

docs.title: What You're Seeing
docs.text: This file is actually named 010--introduction.md in the source, but the URL shows as /getting-started/introduction/.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
1. Clean URLs: No numeric prefixes in the final URLs
  2. Maintained Order: Files still sort correctly in the navigation
  3. Automatic Processing: No manual intervention needed

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
Continue to the Installation Guide to learn more.

File Naming Convention

We use the pattern NUMBER--filename.md where NUMBER helps control the order.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
Install the plugin using pip:

pip install mkdocs-strip-number-prefix

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
Add the plugin to your mkdocs.yml:

plugins:
  - search
  - strip-number-prefix:
      pattern: '^\\d+--'
      strict: true
      strip_links: true

docs.title: Options Explained
docs.text: Option Default Description pattern ^\\d+-- Regex pattern to match and strip strict false Fail on URL collisions strip_links false Rewrite internal markdown links

docs.title: Basic Setup
docs.text:
The simplest configuration just enables the plugin:

plugins:
  - strip-number-prefix

docs.title: Custom Patterns
docs.text:
You can customize the prefix pattern:

plugins:
  - strip-number-prefix:
      pattern: '^\\d{3}_'  # Matches 001_filename.md

docs.title: Strict Mode
docs.text:
Enable strict mode to catch URL collisions:

plugins:
  - strip-number-prefix:
      strict: true  # Build fails if two files map to same URL

docs.title: Link Rewriting
docs.text:
Automatically update internal links:

plugins:
  - strip-number-prefix:
      strip_links: true  # Rewrites [text](file.md) to [text](file.md)

Back to Getting Started | Next: Basic Syntax

docs.text: Markdown supports six levels of headings:

docs.title: Alternative Syntax
docs.text: You can also use underline syntax for H1 and H2:

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
• Use H1 for page titles
  • Use H2 for main sections
  • Use H3-H6 for subsections
  • Keep hierarchy consistent

File Location

This file is 020--basic-syntax/010--headings.md but appears at /basic-syntax/headings/

Next: Text Formatting

docs.title: Basic Formatting
docs.text:
• Bold text using **text** or __text__
  • Italic text using *text* or _text_
  • Bold and italic using ***text***
  • ~~Strikethrough~~ using ~~text~~

docs.title: Inline Code
docs.text: Use backticks for inline code like this: `code`

  • Incomplete task

  • Completed subtask
  • Incomplete subtask

docs.title: Basic Links
docs.text:
• External link
  • Link with title
  • https://www.example.com - Automatic link

docs.title: Internal Links
docs.text:
• Back to home
  • Getting Started section
  • Advanced Features

Link Stripping

With strip_links: true, internal links to numbered files are automatically rewritten!

docs.title: Reference Links
docs.text:
You can use reference-style links for cleaner markdown.

Define them anywhere in the document:

docs.text:

docs.title: Fenced Code Blocks
docs.text:
def strip_prefix(filename: str, pattern: str = r'^\d+--') -> str:
    """Remove numeric prefix from filename."""
    import re
    return re.sub(pattern, '', filename)

docs.title: Language Highlighting
docs.text:
// JavaScript example
const stripPrefix = (filename, pattern = /^\d+--/) => {
    return filename.replace(pattern, '');
};

# YAML configuration
plugins:
  - strip-number-prefix:
      pattern: '^\d+--'
      strict: true

docs.title: Line Numbers
docs.text:
def process_files(files):
    for file in files:
        # Strip the prefix
        clean_name = strip_prefix(file.name)
        # Update the file
        file.url = clean_name

docs.title: Highlighting Lines
docs.text:
def important_function():
    # This line is highlighted
    result = calculate_something()
    # This line is also highlighted
    return result * 2

docs.title: Admonitions
docs.text:
Admonitions are special styled blocks for important information.

Note Title

This is a note admonition. Use it for supplementary information.

Pro Tip

The strip-number-prefix plugin works seamlessly with MkDocs Material's admonitions!

Warning

Make sure your file naming is consistent to avoid URL collisions.

Danger

Never use the same number prefix for multiple files in the same directory.

Success

Your documentation now has clean URLs!

Question

Did you know you can customize the prefix pattern?

Information

This plugin is compatible with all MkDocs themes.

Example

plugins:
  - strip-number-prefix:
      pattern: '^\d{3}_'

Quote

"Clean URLs make for better documentation" - Every developer

docs.title: Collapsible Admonitions
docs.text:
Click to expand

This content is hidden by default!

Expanded by default

This content is visible by default but can be collapsed.

Previous: Tables | Next: Images

docs.title: Basic Image Syntax
docs.text:
![Alt text](path/to/image.png)
![Alt text](path/to/image.png "Optional title")

docs.text: [![Alt text](image.png)](https://example.com)

docs.title: Reference-Style Images
docs.text:
![Alt text][image-ref]

[image-ref]: path/to/image.png "Optional title"

docs.title: Image Alignment (with CSS)
docs.text: ![Centered Image](https://via.placeholder.com/200x100/0088cc/ffffff?text=Centered)     ![Right Aligned](https://via.placeholder.com/150x75/00aa00/ffffff?text=Right)

docs.title: Images and Prefixes
docs.text:
Image Paths

Image paths are not affected by the strip-number-prefix plugin. Only markdown files have their URLs transformed.

docs.text:
This is a figure caption using HTML

Previous: Admonitions | Back to Advanced Features | Next Section: Examples

docs.title: Documentation Structure
docs.text:
Here's how you might structure a real project:

docs/
├── 010--getting-started/
│   ├── 010--quickstart.md
│   ├── 020--installation.md
│   └── 030--first-steps.md
├── 020--user-guide/
│   ├── 010--basics.md
│   ├── 020--configuration.md
│   └── 030--advanced.md
└── 030--reference/
    ├── 010--api.md
    └── 020--cli.md

Results in URLs: - /getting-started/quickstart/ - /getting-started/installation/ - /user-guide/basics/ - etc.

docs.title: Complete Configuration Example
docs.text:
site_name: My Documentation
site_url: https://example.com
theme:
  name: material
  features:
    - navigation.tabs
    - navigation.sections
    - navigation.expand

plugins:
  - search
  - strip-number-prefix:
      pattern: '^\d+--'
      strict: true
      strip_links: true

nav:
  - Home: index.md
  - Getting Started:
    - Introduction: 010--getting-started/010--introduction.md
    - Installation: 010--getting-started/020--installation.md
  - User Guide:
    - Basics: 020--user-guide/010--basics.md

Next: Common Patterns

docs.title: Three-Digit Prefixes
docs.text: pattern: '^\d{3}--'  # Matches: 001--file.md, 010--file.md

docs.title: Underscore Separator
docs.text: pattern: '^\d+_'     # Matches: 01_file.md, 10_file.md

docs.title: Dot Notation
docs.text: pattern: '^\d+\.'    # Matches: 1.file.md, 10.file.md

docs.title: Complex Patterns
docs.text: pattern: '^[0-9]{2,4}-'  # Matches: 01-file.md, 0001-file.md

docs.title: Migration Strategy
docs.text:
When migrating existing docs:

  1. Add prefixes gradually: 

    mv introduction.md 010--introduction.md
mv installation.md 020--installation.md

  2. Enable link rewriting: 

    strip_links: true  # Automatically updates internal links

  3. Test with strict mode: 

    strict: true  # Catches any URL collisions

docs.title: URL Collisions
docs.text:
If you get collision errors: 

Error: URL collision detected
- 010--setup.md -> setup/
- 020--setup.md -> setup/  # Collision!

Solution: Use unique names after the prefix.

Previous: Real-World Usage | Next: Best Practices

docs.title: Do's ✅
docs.text:
• Use consistent padding: 010--, 020--, not 10--, 20--
  • Leave gaps for future files: 010--, 020--, 030--
  • Use descriptive names after prefix: 010--getting-started.md
  • Group related content with similar prefixes

docs.title: Don'ts ❌
docs.text:
• Don't mix patterns in same project
  • Don't use same numbers in same directory
  • Don't rely on prefixes for security
  • Don't use special characters in prefixes

docs.title: Recommended Structure
docs.text:
010--basics/
  010--introduction.md
  020--quickstart.md
  030--installation.md
020--features/
  010--core-features.md
  020--advanced-features.md
030--api/
  010--rest-api.md
  020--graphql-api.md

docs.title: Navigation Alignment
docs.text:
Keep your mkdocs.yml nav aligned with file structure:

nav:
  - Basics:
    - Introduction: 010--basics/010--introduction.md
    - Quick Start: 010--basics/020--quickstart.md
  - Features:
    - Core: 020--features/010--core-features.md

docs.title: Performance Considerations
docs.text:
• The plugin processes files once during build
  • Regex compilation is cached
  • No runtime performance impact
  • Compatible with MkDocs caching

docs.title: Summary
docs.text:
The strip-number-prefix plugin helps maintain organized documentation with clean URLs. Follow these practices for best results!

Previous: Common Patterns | Back to Examples | Home
